Article Title: TMC Leader Babla Sarkar Shot Dead: Councillor shot dead by bike-borne assailants in West Bengal's Malda
Article Text:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: Trinamool Congress councillor Dulal Sarkar was shot dead by unidentified miscreants in West Bengal's Malda district on Thursday morning, police said.Sarkar, the TMC councillor from Malda, was shot in the head multiple times from close range by bike-borne assailants at Jhaljhalia More area."He was taken to a nearby hospital, where he succumbed to injuries. A probe has been initiated and we are trying to identify the culprits," a senior police officer said.Chief minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee expressed shock over the killing of Sarkar, who was popularly known as Babla."My close associate and a very popular leader, Babla Sarkar, was murdered today. From the beginning of the Trinamool Congress, he (and his wife Chaitali Sarkar) worked hard for the party, and Babla was also elected a councillor," she said in a post on X."... I am so shocked and sad that I do not know how to convey my condolences to the bereaved family. May God give Chaitali strength to survive and fight the battle," she added.
Article Summary: Trinamool Congress councillor Dulal Sarkar was shot dead by unidentified miscreants in West Bengal's Malda district. Sarkar, the TMC councillor from Malda, was shot in the head multiple times from close range by bike-borne assailants at Jhaljhalia More area.

Article Title: Shimla Snowfall: New year brings more cold, Himachal Pradesh braces for rain and snow
Article Text:
Solang Valley covered in snow on Wednesday

SHIMLA: Amid ongoing cold wave in Himachal Pradesh , the weather department has predicted rain and snowfall in the state from Thursday onwards.According to the Meteorological Centre, Shimla , light rain and snowfall will occur in the mid and high hills of the state on the Jan 2 and 3. There is also a likelihood of snowfall on Jan 4 and Jan 7 in the mid and high hills, and at most places on Jan 6.As per the forecast, the maximum temperature will gradually fall by over many parts of the state over the next three to four days. The weather department has also warned of dense fog in areas near the Bhakra Dam reservoir in Bilaspur and in the Balh Valley of Mandi district in early morning and evening hours in the coming days.Meanwhile, the cold wave continued in the state despite a clear day on Wednesday. Tabo was the coldest place in Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday, with the lowest minimum temperature recorded at -16.7°C.Meanwhile, Samdo in La haul Spiti shivered at -11.2°C, Kalpa recorded a minimum temperature of -3.8°C, and Seobagh in Kullu recorded a minimum temperature of -0.3°C.Tourist destination Manali recorded a minimum temperature of 2.4°C, Shimla 7.6°C, Dharamshala 5.9°C, Chamba 5.1°C, and Kasauli 9.2°C. Chamba also recorded the maximum temperature of 23.3°C on Wednesday.
Article Summary: The weather department has predicted rain and snowfall in the state from Thursday onwards. The cold wave continued on Wednesday despite a clear day. Tabo was the coldest place in Himachal Pradesh with the lowest minimum temperature recorded at -16.7°C. Chamba recorded the maximum temperature of 23.3°C on Wednesday.

Article Title: 'Kejriwal in love with bogus voters': BJP slams AAP over voter list 'discrepancy'
Article Text:
Delhi BJP President Virendra Sachdeva (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: The BJP on Thursday launched an attack at the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), claiming that its chief Arvind Kejriwal fostered a "love for bogus voters". The party further alleged that some AAP leaders and their family members have dual voter registrations .At a press conference, Delhi BJP president Virendra Sachdeva unveiled a poster titled "Farzi voters se ishq hai" (In love with fake voters), taking a direct jab at Kejriwal and his party.Sachdeva alleged that AAP MP Sanjay Singh, in his 2018 affidavit for Rajya Sabha, declared himself a voter in Delhi’s Hari Nagar assembly constituency, even though his name also appeared in the voter list of Sultanpur municipality in Uttar Pradesh, his hometown.He further claimed that Singh’s wife, Anita, had applied for the deletion of her voter registration in Sultanpur only on January 4, 2024, days before Singh filed his parliamentary affidavit on January 8, 2024, which still reflected her as a registered voter there."Sanjay Singh claims that his wife Anita Singh's name was removed from the Sultanpur voter list on January 4, 2024. However, while filing his parliamentary affidavit on January 8, 2024, her name was still registered as a voter in Sultanpur," Sachdeva said.Responding to the allegations, Singh defended himself, saying that the application for his wife's vote deletion was submitted as per the required process."On January 4, she submitted applications for deletion of her vote in Sultanpur. The affidavit was submitted on January 8, and until the process is complete, the address remains the same. Once the voter list is updated, the new address will be recorded," he added.Sachdeva called for legal action from the Election Commission and Delhi Police against Singh, alleging "discrepancy" in voter registration. He also accused Singh of hastily applying for a vote transfer on December 30 after the BJP highlighted the issue.The BJP leader further alleged that Delhi mayor Mahesh Kumar's wife held dual voter registrations under different names from the same address and photo. While no immediate response was available from the mayor, Sachdeva mentioned that a case regarding two voter ID cards allegedly held by Kejriwal's wife was pending in the high court.AAP MP Singh countered these claims by disclosing that he had already filed defamation cases against BJP leaders, including Amit Malviya and Manoj Tiwari, over similar allegations.Taking a dig at Singh, Sachdeva said, "What dignity does a person have when he is already out on bail and creates double voter registrations even while serving as a Member of Parliament?"
Article Summary: Delhi BJP president Virendra Sachdeva unveiled a poster titled "Farzi voters se ishq hai" (In love with fake voters) He claimed that AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal fostered a "love for bogus voters" The party further alleged that some AAP leaders and their family members have dual voter registrations.

Article Title: Amritpal set to float party on January 14 as SAD's alternative
Article Text: AMRITSAR: Jailed Punjab MP and hardline Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh 's associates are poised to launch a new party aimed at offering an alternative to Shiromani Akali Dal to the people of Punjab, reports Yudhvir Rana. The formal announcement will be made at Maghi Mela in Muktsar on Jan 14."We have convened a conference at Sri Muktsar Sahib on Maghi Mela in which a committee will be formed. It will be tasked with drafting the constitution of the new party, deciding its name, establishing an advisory committee, creating district-wise committees, and handling legal formalities," Tarsem Singh, father of Amritpal, said Thursday.SAD is also slated to hold a rally at Maghi Mela, to be addressed by senior functionaries including former deputy chief minister Sukhbir Singh Badal.Tarsem claimed the support of like-minded people, including Faridkot MP Sarabjit Singh Khalsa and Paramjit Kaur Khalra, rights activist and son of former PM Indira Gandhi's assassin Beant Singh. The two will be part of the new party.
Article Summary: Jailed Punjab MP and hardline Sikh preacher Amritpal Singh's associates are poised to launch a new party aimed at offering an alternative to Shiromani Akali Dal. The formal announcement will be made at Maghi Mela in Muktsar on Jan 14.

Article Title: Bombay high court relief for student who was denied AIIMS PG seat after missing flight
Article Text: NAGPUR: Bombay HC Thursday came to the rescue of a PG medical aspirant who was denied participation in counselling for admission to AIIMS Kalyani in Bengal for not reporting on time due to a missed flight last year.Terming the case 'exceptional', court directed AIIMS authorities to allow 27-year-old petitioner Kalyani Chakrawar to participate in the ongoing admission process.Chakrawar, with all-India rank of 119, was allotted seat in general medicine at AIIMS Kalyani. She was required to complete admission formalities by 5pm on Dec 24. However, she missed her scheduled flight from Nagpur to Kolkata, failing to report in time. After AIIMS refused to consider her requests to allow her to take part in second round of counselling, she moved HC.Despite Christmas vacation, HC held an emergency hearing on Dec 31, asking AIIMS authorities to file a response. After reviewing arguments from both sides, the court ruled in her favour, allowing her to join the second round of admissions.Chakrawar, currently enrolled in radio diagnostics programme at AIIMS Nagpur, had applied for a transfer to AIIMS Kalyan, seeking admission in general medicine specialty.
Article Summary: Kalyani Chakrawar, with all-India rank of 119, was allotted seat in general medicine at AIIMS Kalyani. She was required to complete admission formalities by 5pm on Dec 24. She missed her scheduled flight from Nagpur to Kolkata, failing to report in time.

Article Title: Maharashtra sets up SIT to probe murder of Beed sarpanch
Article Text: MUMBAI: The state government Wednesday formed a 10-member SIT to probe the murder of Massajog village sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh , a government resolution stated. The SIT will be headed by CID Deputy Inspector General Basavraj Teli. The other nine members are police officials from Beed district, where the crime occurred.The formation of the SIT comes a day after Valmik Karad, booked in an extortion bid case related to the murder, surrendered before CID and was sent to 14 days police custody. Opposition has alleged that Karad is the prime accused in the case, while he maintains he is the victim of political vendetta. Karad is a close aide of food and civil supplies minister Dhananjay Munde from NCP. His alleged involvement in the crime created a political storm across the state. Opposition has demanded removal of Munde from the state cabinet.Deshmukh, sarpanch of Massajog village in Kej tehsil of Beed district, was abducted and brutally killed on December 9.
Article Summary: The SIT will be headed by CID Deputy Inspector General Basavraj Teli. The other nine members are police officials from Beed district, where the crime occurred. Valmik Karad, booked in an extortion bid case related to the murder, surrendered before CID and was sent to 14 days police custody.

Article Title: Those who became arrogant were stopped at 241 by Lord Ram: RSS leader Indresh Kumar on LS poll results
Article Text:
RSS leader Indresh Kumar

JAIPUR: In hard-hitting remarks on the outcome of the Lok sabha polls , RSS leader Indresh Kumar on Thursday slammed the ruling BJP for "arrogance" and the opposition INDIA bloc for being "anti-Ram". Speaking at the 'Ramrath Ayodhya Yatra Darshan Poojan Samaroh' event held in Kanota near Jaipur, Kumar criticized both parties without explicitly naming them.Referring to the BJP, Kumar said, “The party which did the bhakti (of lord Ram ) but became arrogant was stopped at 241 but it was made the biggest party,” highlighting the BJP's 240 seats in the Lok Sabha."And those who had no faith in Ram, they together were stopped at 234," he said, apparently referring to the INDIA bloc."See the 'Vidhan' of Ram Rajya in democracy; those who did 'Bhakti (worshipped) of Ram but gradually turned arrogant, that party emerged as the biggest party, but the vote and power that should have been given was stopped by God due to their arrogance," he said."Those who opposed Ram, none of them was given power. Even all of them together were made number two. God's justice is true and enjoyable," he said."Those who worship Ram should be humble and those who oppose Ram, the Lord himself dealt with them," he said.He said Lord Ram does not discriminate and does not punish. "Ram does not make anyone lament. Ram gives justice to everyone. He gives and will keep on giving. Lord Ram was always just and will remain so," he said.Kumar also said Lord Ram protected people and did good to Ravana too.These remarks came shortly after RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat declared that a true 'sevak' should serve people without arrogance and maintain dignity.
Article Summary: Indresh Kumar slammed the ruling BJP for "arrogance" and the opposition INDIA bloc for being "anti-Ram" Speaking at the 'Ramrath Ayodhya Yatra Darshan Poojan Samaroh' event held in Kanota near Jaipur.

Article Title: NEET-UG row: Tejashwi Yadav breaks silence on allegations of aide's involvement
Article Text:
RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticizes Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha for alleging involvement of Tejashwi's aide in NEET-UG 2024 exam paper leaks and malpractices.

PATNA : Coming down heavily on Bihar deputy chief minister Vijay Kumar Sinha , RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticised him for linking one of his aides to the alleged paper leaks and malpractices surrounding the NEET-UG 2024 examination.Tejashwi Yadav while interacting with reporters, said, "The INDIA alliance is united on this issue. We want the NEET exam to be immediately cancelled. The BJP has all the investigation agencies. They can call the PS or PA anyone for probe. They want to divert the issue from the kingpin. Those who want to drag my name or my PA's name, this will not benefit anyone. The engineer who is talked about could be a beneficiary but Amit Anand and Nitish Kumar are the masterminds of the paper leak . The people of the country know that whenever BJP comes to power, then paper leaks happen."Yadav emphasized the unity of the INDIA alliance in demanding the cancellation of the NEET exam and accused the BJP of attempting to divert attention from the main culprits behind the alleged paper leak.On Thursday, Vijay Kumar Sinha, the Deputy Chief Minister of Bihar, claimed during a press conference that the prime suspect arrested in the NEET "paper leak" case had connections to officials linked to Tejashwi Yadav. Sinha claimed that the official maintained regular contact with Sikander Prasad Yadvendu, the prime accused in the case, and arranged accommodations for him at guest houses in Patna and other locations.The RJD dismissed these allegations as a "bundle of lies" intended to shift focus from the demand to cancel the May 5 exam.Sinha further said that there are reports indicating the accused's association with RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav during his judicial custody in Ranchi. He emphasized the need for a thorough investigation into the matter and questioned Tejashwi Prasad's silence on the issue.The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Bihar Police had arrested 13 individuals last month as part of their investigation into the alleged NEET-UG 2024 paper leak. The arrested individuals included examinees, their parents, and the alleged mastermind, Sikander Prasad Yadvendu. Sinha accused RJD leaders of engaging in corrupt practices, citing reports suggesting the accused's association with Lalu Prasad Yadav during his judicial custody in Ranchi.
Article Summary: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha accused Tejashwi Yadav's aide of involvement in NEET-UG 2024 exam paper leaks and malpractices. Sinha claimed that the official maintained regular contact with Sikander Prasad Yadvendu, the prime accused in the case. The RJD dismissed these allegations as a "bundle of lies"

Article Title: 'Future PM Akhilesh Yadav': Poster come up in Lucknow ahead of SP chief's birthday
Article Text:
Workers put up posters of Akhilesh Yadav outside SP office

LUCKNOW: A hoarding portraying Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav as the "future Prime Minister" was put up outside the party headquarters in Lucknow.Prior to his birthday on July 1, party workers displayed numerous posters outside SP office. Reports suggest that party members erected the hoarding to celebrate the party's significant victory in Uttar Pradesh during the recent Lok Sabha elections.The Samajwadi Party-Congress alliance secured 43 Lok Sabha seats, limiting the BJP and its partners to only 34, a decline of approximately 29 seats compared to their performance in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections when they won 64 seats.Akhilesh Yadav defeated BJP’s sitting MP by 1,70,076 votes. He secured 6,40,207 votes while Subrat Pathak got 4,70,131 votes. In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, there were 15 candidates contesting from Kannauj Lok Sabha constituency.SP leader Awadhesh Prasad caused a political stir by defeating two-time BJP MP Lallu Singh in the Faizabad Lok Sabha seat in Ayodhya district.This is not the first instance of posters proclaiming Yadav as the country'sfuture PM . Earlier, on June 4 similar poster had surfaced depicting party chief Akhilesh Yadav as the 'PM to be' seen during the celebrations in Kannauj.In October 2023, the Samajwadi Party's Lucknow office showcased a poster resembling the previous one, put up by Fakhrul Hasan 'Chaand', a party spokesperson. When questioned about the motive behind the poster, Hasan stated, "Akhilesh Yadav's birthday is on July 1, but to express their love and respect towards their leader, Samajwadi Party workers celebrate his birthday multiple times."Chaand further said that the party workers are hoping and praying for Akhilesh Yadav to become the Prime Minister of India, enabling him to serve the people of the nation.However, Yadav dismissed the "Future PM" hoardings featuring him in Lucknow, stating that no one becomes prime minister merely by putting up posters.Similar hoardings with slogans such as "We trust Akhilesh to lead the state and the nation, the country needs a new PM" were also seen at various locations in the state capital before the 2019 general elections.
Article Summary: Workers put up posters of Akhilesh Yadav outside SP office in Lucknow. Reports suggest that party members erected the hoarding to celebrate the party's significant victory in Uttar Pradesh during the recent Lok Sabha elections. Samajwadi Party-Congress alliance secured 43 Lok Sabha seats, limiting the BJP and its partners to only 34.
